data.name: s5 p2
data.value: Reunification of family members in Canada as part of the family sponsorship program and obtaining PR status. Canada prioritizes families who wish to reunite with their family members in Canada.

data.value: Canada has one of the highest standards of education. in the world! We welcome students every year to realize their dreams of studying in Canada. We are preparing a complete Temporary Resident Visa (TRV) application to guarantee the best chance..

data.name: s5 p4
data.value: If you are a business person or manager wishing to immigrate to Canada, the Canadian federal and provincial governments offer a range of options that may allow you to expedite the process of immigrating to Canada

data.name: s5 p5
data.value: A work permit authorizes a foreign worker to work and earn a living in Canada. An open work permit allows individuals to work for any Canadian employer.

data.name: s16 p1.1
data.value: How does the form IMM5409 – Declaration of Common Law Partnership work? Does it expire? If the relationship is over, do I have to cancel it?

data.name: s16 p1.2
data.value: The form never expires, for immigration purposes it works the same way as a marriage certificate. If the relationship is over, there is no need to cancel it or process any other paperwork. If you have ever submitted an immigration application where you declared the common-law union, you have to remember not to omit it in any new applications you might submit in the future.

data.name: s16 p2.1
data.value: I am applying for a work permit outside Canada. Is it better to apply for it alone or with a dependent family?

data.name: s16 p2.2
data.value:
This is entirely your decision, and there are pros and cons on both sides.
In general, it is safe to apply for the work permit as a family if your annual income, as per your job offer, is equal or higher than the double the required settlement funds for the size of your family. for instance, for a family with 2 children your gross income should be no less than @24,553*2=49,106.

data.name: s16 p3.1
data.value: I have a child who is Canadian citizen. Do I have to mention the child in the generic application form? Do I have to provide the baby’s photos?

data.name: s16 p3.2
data.value: You have to mention the child in the application form and mark that they are not included in the application as a Canadian-born citizen. You will not have to provide the photograph for that child, but the proof of Canadian citizenship (passport of birth certificate) are necessary. If you have to provide the proof of funds (POF) in your application, the child will have to figure in the calculation.

data.name: s16 p4.1
data.value: I did my biometrics in Dec 2020, do I need to pay for them again when paying the fees? Or just submit the IRCC number of the tag they gave me when I did them?

data.name: s16 p4.2
data.value: Your biometrics are linked to your UCI number and are valid for 10 years. Unless specifically requested, you do not need to do anything or upload anything.

data.name: s16 p5.1
data.value: My education and work experience are unrelated. Should I still just send my diploma and other documents to WES for the assessment, or do I have to follow another approach?

data.name: s16 p5.2
data.value: There is no requirement or your education and work experience to be related. WES assessment gives you a certain number of points in the Express Entry system, regardless of whether you ever worked in the profession or not. Likewise, your work experience is assessed regardless of whether or not you have relevant education.
